org.purewidgets.client.widgets
Class GuiTagCloud

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Composite
              org.purewidgets.client.widgets.GuiWidget
                  org.purewidgets.client.widgets.GuiTagCloud
All Implemented Interfaces:
HasAttachHandlers, HasHandlers, EventListener, HasVisibility, IsRenderable, IsWidget, InputFeedbackListener, ActionListener, InputListener, ReferenceCodeListener
public class GuiTagCloud
extends GuiWidget
implements ActionListener

The tag cloud widget is a visual representation of a tag cloud.

CSS Style Rules

.instantplaces-GuiTagCloud
the outer <div> element
.instantplaces-GuiTagCloud .tag
the <span> element for each word
.instantplaces-GuiTagCloud .tagspanel
the panel that holds the list of tags and the textbox

Author:
Jorge C. S. Cardoso

          Possible ordering of tags in the tag cloud.

Constructor Detail

GuiTagCloud

public GuiTagCloud(String widgetId)

public GuiTagCloud(String widgetId,
                   boolean allowUserInput)

GuiTagCloud

public GuiTagCloud(String widgetId,
                   String[] tags,
                   int[] frequency,
                   boolean allowUserInput)
The TagCloud is actually a composite widget with just one component -- the TextBox -- so, although, we give it a widgetId, the TagCloud itself is never sent to the Widgetmanager, only the TextBox. We never call sendToServer() in the constructor.

Parameters:
widgetId -
tags -
frequency -
allowUserInput -
